item.title: Race to lead D.C. lawyers' association grows heated amid attacks on law firms
item.description: More than 30,000 people have already voted in the election for the president of the D.C. Bar Association, more than triple the previous record set in ...

item.title: Stocks soar after U.S. and China agree to temporarily slash tariffs
item.description: Stocks soared — and businesses breathed a sigh of relief — as the U.S. and China agreed to temporarily slash their triple-digit tariffs.

item.title: Catholics at Villanova University, where Pope Leo XIV once attended, celebrate Mass
item.description: Pope Leo XIV once attended Villanova University. Catholics packed the St. Thomas of Villanova church to celebrate Sunday Mass and the new pope.

item.title: Hamas to release Israeli-American hostage held in Gaza, Edan Alexander
item.description: Alexander, a 21 year-old Israeli soldier raised in New Jersey, is the last remaining U.S. citizen captured by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023 and held in Gaza, ...

item.title: Pope Leo XIV asks journalists to use communication as a tool for peace
item.description: The remarks come just one day after calling for a ceasefire and access to humanitarian aid in Gaza and an end to the war in Ukraine.
